page.title: 15Property In Sparham
page.content: Sparham lies off the A1067 Norwich to Fakenham road. It has no modern estates and is not likely to expand in the forseeable future as there are no mains drains. There is a variety of housing, both privately owned and Council property, ranging in value from Â£17000 to Â£67000. Most of the houses are brick but there is some carr stone as well. A Norfolk barn is scheduled for conversion to a dwelling. There is mains water & elec- tricity but no North Sea gas, although some people use Calor gas. Oil or solid fuel is used for central heating; most houses have septic tanks but there is at least one house with an outside water tap and a toilet for which there is a night soil collection. The village pump remains as an emergency water supply.
